iatiStatus.label: Status
iatiStatus.tooltip:
1. Pipeline/identification: the project is being scoped or planned
  2. Implementation: the project is currently being implemented
  3. Completion: the project is complete or the final disbursement has been made
  4. Post-completion: the project is complete or the final disbursement has been made, but the project remains open pending financial sign off or M&E
  5. Cancelled: the project has been cancelled
  6. Suspended: the project has been temporarily suspended or the reporting partner no longer uses RSR.

iatiActivityId.label: IATI identifier
iatiActivityId.tooltip:
This is a globally unique identifier for this activity. It is a requirement to be compliant with the IATI standard. This code consists of:
[country code]-[Chamber of Commerce number]-[organisation’s internal project code].
For Dutch organisations this is e.g. NL-KVK-31156201-TZ1234. For more information click here

language.label: Language
language.tooltip: Enter the language used when entering the details for this project.

currency.label: Currency
currency.tooltip: The default currency for this project. Used in all financial aspects of the project.

currentImageCredit.label: Photo caption
currentImageCredit.tooltip: Briefly describe who or what you see in the photo.

currentImageCaption.label: Photo credit
currentImageCaption.tooltip: Enter the name of the person who took the photo

defaultAidTypeVocabulary.label: Default aid type vocabulary
defaultAidTypeVocabulary.tooltip: This is the IATI identifier for the type of vocabulary being used for describing the type of the aid being supplied or activity being undertaken. For reference, please visit: http://iatistandard.org/203/codelists/AidTypeVocabulary/

defaultAidType.label: Default aid type
defaultAidType.tooltip: This is the IATI identifier for the type of aid being supplied or activity being undertaken. This element specifies a default for all the project’s financial transactions. This can be overridden at the individual transaction level. For reference, please visit: http://iatistandard.org/202/codelists/AidType/

defaultFlowType.label: Default flow type
defaultFlowType.tooltip: This is the IATI identifier for how the activity (project) is funded. For reference, please visit: http://iatistandard.org/202/codelists/FlowType/

defaultTiedStatus.label: Default tied status
defaultTiedStatus.tooltip: This element specifies a default for all the activity’s financial transactions; it can be overridden at the individual transaction level. For reference, please visit: http://iatistandard.org/202/codelists/TiedStatus/

collaborationType.label: Collaboration type
collaborationType.tooltip: This is the IATI identifier for the type of collaboration involved. For reference, please visit: http://iatistandard.org/202/codelists/CollaborationType/

defaultFinanceType.label: Default finance type
defaultFinanceType.tooltip: This is the IATI identifier for the type of finance. This element specifies a default for all the transactions in the project’s activity report; it can be overridden at the individual transaction level. For reference visit: http://iatistandard.org/202/codelists/FinanceType/
